fact: France is the most visited country in the world with over 89 million tourists annually.
Ethiopia follows a calendar that is seven years and eight months behind the Western calendar.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
There is one vending machine for every 23 people in Japan.
Russia has 11 different time zones, the most of any country in the world.
Australia is home to more than 10,000 beaches; you could visit a new one every day for over 27 years.
Iceland is the only country in the world that has no mosquitoes.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years.
It is illegal to own just one guinea pig in Switzerland because they are social animals and get lonely.
Monaco is smaller than New York City's Central Park.
India has the largest postal network in the world, including a floating post office in Dal Lake, Srinagar.
There are no snakes in the wild in New Zealand.
The Netherlands has more bicycles than it has people.
Bolivia is home to the Salar de Uyuni, the world's largest salt flat, which contains 10 billion tonnes of salt.
